Submodules¶

tools.chempiler_setup module¶

:mod:”chempiler_setup” – Setup and initialisation routines for the Chemputer¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

Performs the initial setup of the Chempiler Reads and sanitises a graph from a GraphML file. This graph is populated with objects related to the platform e.g. Stirrer plates, pumps, etc

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class tools.chempiler_setup.Setup(graphml_file, simulation=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Performs the inital set up of the Chempiler rig Creates a graph object which maps the topology of the physical system

Parameters

  • graphml_file (str) – Absolute path to the graphml file to parse

  • simulation (bool) – Whether or not we’re simulating hardware

load_graph(file)[source]¶

Loads a .graphml file containing the architecture, discards unnecessary information and relabels the nodes.

Parameters

file – GraphML file containing the architecture

Returns

sanitised graph object

setup_platform()[source]¶

Performs the set up of the platform_server Populates the graph with instances of the relavent module objects

Returns

Graph object populated with module objects

Return type

graph (ChemOSGraph)

setup_pumps_and_valves()[source]¶

Populates the graph with pump and valve objects and initialises them. Adapted from chemputer_control.py from the old ChemOS

setup_serial_devices()[source]¶

Grabs all serial devices from the graph and instantiates them.

setup_special_devices()[source]¶

Finds all devices that have two physical inputs (e.g. separator, filter etc.), find the attached “bottom”, and deletes the edge between them.

tools.cmd_execution module¶

:mod:”cmd_execution” – Command dispatcher and deep control layer for the Chemputer¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This module provides a class that takes possession of the physical resources via the various module executioners, and carries out commands supplied as a list of “opcode” and arguments. This is the heart of the Chemputer control.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class tools.cmd_execution.Executioner(graph, simulation=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Judge. Jury. Executioner.

Parameters

  • graph (ChemOSGraph) – Graph object representing the physical platform_server, populated with module objects

  • simulation (bool) – Whether or not this is a simulation

execute(cmd)[source]¶

Executes the command, depending on the operation move that is passed

Parameters

cmd (List) – List of arguments for a command

get_device_objects(flag)[source]¶

Goes through the graph, grabbing the objects that held in the nodes depending on the passed flag

Parameters

flag (str) – Flag identifying what objects to retrieve (Pumps, Valves, Stirrer, Rotavap, etc.)

Returns

Dictionary containing the name of the device and its associated object

Return type

device_dict (Dict)

Raises

Exception – No objects found

join_parallel_operations()[source]¶

Joins all parallel execution threads before processing a sequential command

process_camera_cmds(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command involving the camera

Commands are: [SET_RECORDING_SPEED]

Parameters

cmd (List) – List of commands

process_chiller_cmds(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command involving the recirculation chiller

Commands are: [START_CHILLER, STOP_CHILLER, SET_CHILLER, RAMP_CHILLER]

Parameters

cmd (List) – List of commands

process_pump_cmd(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command that involves the pumps/valves Commands are [MOVE, HOME]

Parameters

cmd (List) – Command arguments

process_rotavap_cmd(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command involving the rotavap

Commands are [START_HEATER, STOP_HEATER, START_ROTATION, STOP_ROTATION, LIFT_UP, LIFT_DOWN, RESET, SET_BATH_TEMP, SET_ROTATION]

Parameters

cmd (List) – Command arguments

process_stirring_cmd(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command involving the stirrer plates Commands are [STIR, HEAT, SET_TEMP, SET_STIR_RPM]

Parameters

cmd (List) – Command arguments

process_vacuum_cmds(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command involving the Vacuum pump

Commands are: [INIT, GET_VAC_SP, SET_VAC_SP, START_VAC, STOP_VAC, VENT, GET_STATUS, GET_END_VAC_SP, SET_END_VAC_SP, GET_RUNTIME_SP, SET_RUNTIME_SP]

Parameters

cmd (List) – List of commands

process_waiting_cmd(cmd)[source]¶

Processes a command for waiting on the platform_server

Parameters

cmd (List) – Command arguments

wait_with_feedback(wait_time)[source]¶

Waits for a desired time and prints the wait progress.

Parameters

wait_time (int) – Time to wait in seconds

tools.constants module¶

:mod:”constants” – Global constants file for easy maintenance¶

  1. 2018 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This file contains all constants used in the Chempiler project, such as dictionary keys, device types, and so forth. Keeping them all in one file makes future maintenance a lot easier and avoids duplicates.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

tools.vlogging module¶

:mod:”vlogging” – Utilities for video logging¶

  1. 2018 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This file contains all utilities required to record webcam videos at variable frame rates, with time stamp, and the current INFO level log message overlaid.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class tools.vlogging.RecordingSpeedFilter(name='')[source]¶

Bases: logging.Filter

Logging filter that only allows messages with logging level 5 to be passed on. Used for controlling video recording speed.

filter(record)[source]¶

Determine if the specified record is to be logged.

Is the specified record to be logged? Returns 0 for no, nonzero for yes. If deemed appropriate, the record may be modified in-place.

class tools.vlogging.VlogHandler(queue=None)[source]¶

Bases: logging.Handler

Logging module handler class. Inherits directly from the logging.Handler prototype, as no fancy stuff is required.

emit(record)[source]¶

Emit a record.

If a formatter is specified, it is used to format the record. The record is then put into the queue.

flush()[source]¶

Empties the queue by popping all items until it’s empty.

tools.vlogging.recording_worker(message_queue, recording_speed_queue, video_path)[source]¶

Worker process which records a video to a file at variable frame rate. The main loop grabs an image from the camera, overlays a time stamp and the most recent log message, and then waits the appropriate time until the next frame is due. Log messages and requests to change recording speed are passed via multiprocessing queues. This worker is meant to be run as an individual process to improve performance in cPython.

Parameters

  • message_queue (multiprocessing.Queue) – A queue object containing logging messages

  • recording_speed_queue (multiprocessing.Queue) – A queue object containing requests to change frame rate

  • video_path (str) – A path to the output video file
